SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models

Class FoodStorage

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models.FoodStorage
public class FoodStorage extends Object
A class representing a food storage system.

The class provides methods for adding and removing grocery objects, and decreasing the amount of a grocery object to reflect user consumption. The class also provides methods for retrieving grocery objects, all grocery objects that expire before a given date, and all grocery objects in the food storage, by category, expiration date, and alphabetically.

Since:
V0.1
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

    • groceries

      private final HashMap<String,Grocery> groceries
      A map of grocery objects. The key is the name of the grocery, and the value is the grocery object.

  • Constructor Details

    • FoodStorage

      public FoodStorage()
      Constructs a new empty food storage.

      The method initializes an empty map to store grocery objects.

  • Method Details

    • getAllGroceries

      public List<Grocery> getAllGroceries()
      Returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage.
      Returns:
      a list of all grocery objects in the food storage.

    • getAllGroceriesAlphabetically

      public List<Grocery> getAllGroceriesAlphabetically()
      Returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage, sorted alphabetically by name.

      Objects are sorted in ascending order.

      Returns:
      a list of all grocery objects in the food storage, sorted alphabetically by name.

    • getAllGroceriesByExpirationDate

      public List<Grocery> getAllGroceriesByExpirationDate()
      Returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage, sorted by expiration date.

      Objects are sorted in ascending order.

      Returns:
      a list of all grocery objects in the food storage, sorted by expiration date.

    • getGroceryByName

      public Grocery getGroceryByName(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the grocery object with the specified name.

      If the name is null or an empty string, or if a grocery with the provided name does not exist in the food storage, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the grocery object, case insensitive
      Returns:
      the grocery object with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or an empty string, or if the grocery object does not exist in the food storage.

    • getGroceriesByCategory

      public List<Grocery> getGroceriesByCategory(String category) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that belong to a specified category.

      If the category is null or an empty string, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, it returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that belong to the specified category.

      Parameters:
      category - the category to filter the grocery objects by.
      Returns:
      a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that belong to the specified category.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the category is null or an empty string.

    • getGroceriesExpiringBeforeDate

      public List<Grocery> getGroceriesExpiringBeforeDate(LocalDate date) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that expire before a given date.

      Does not return grocery objects that expire on the given date, only those that expire before.

      If the given date is null, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, it returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that expire before the given date. The list can be empty.

      Parameters:
      date - the date to compare the expiration date of the grocery objects to.
      Returns:
      a list of all grocery objects that expire before the given date. List can be empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given date is null.

    • getGroceriesExpiringOnDate

      public List<Grocery> getGroceriesExpiringOnDate(LocalDate date) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that expire on a given date.

      Does not return grocery objects that expire before the given date, only those that expire on the given date.

      If the given date is null, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, it returns a list of all grocery objects in the food storage that expire on the given date. The list can be empty.

      Parameters:
      date - the date to compare the expiration date of the grocery objects to.
      Returns:
      a list of all grocery objects that expire on the given date. List can be empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given date object is null.

    • addGrocery

      public void addGrocery(Grocery grocery) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a grocery object to the food storage.

      If the grocery object is null, or if the grocery object already exists in the food storage, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      grocery - the grocery object to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the grocery object already exists in the food storage.

    • removeGrocery

      public void removeGrocery(Grocery grocery) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes the specified object from the food storage.

      If the grocery object is null, or if the grocery object does not exist in the food storage, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      grocery - the grocery object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given grocery object does not exist in the food storage.

    • removeAllGroceries

      public void removeAllGroceries()
      Removes all grocery objects from the food storage.
